programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Oklahoma City gained a 3-1 lead in the series with a 128-126 win over Minnesota in Game 4 behind 40 points and 10 assists from Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, along with 34 points from Jalen Williams; Nickeil Alexander-Walker led Minnesota with 23 points.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's College World Series
programme.desc: Texas (51-11), which won two-straight to oust Clemson in the Austin Super Regional, won two of three meetings with the Gators during the regular season; Florida (48-15) seeks its third crown in history after winning back-to-back titles in 2014-15.

programme.desc: UFC Hall of Famers Daniel Cormier and Chael Sonnen select their eight-fighter teams of welterweights and flyweights from 10 different countries, as the action gets underway in the octagon between two of the recently-selected flyweights.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's College World Series
programme.desc: Ole Miss (42-19) makes its maiden Women's College World Series appearance after defeating Arkansas, 7-4, on May 25; Texas Tech (50-12), which has won nine in a row, advanced to the Women's College World Series for the first time in program history.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Vancouver Canucks were one win from becoming the first Canadian team to win a Stanley Cup title since 1993, but a loss to the Chicago Blackhawks in Game 7 of the 2011 Stanley Cup Final caused unrest among the home fans, leading to a massive riot.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: On June 2, 2010, Detroit Tigers pitcher Armando Galarraga was one out away from the first perfect game in franchise history, but a wrong call by umpire Jim Joyce would spoil that opportunity and cause backlash on a worldwide scale.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In the summer of 1998, the St. Louis Cardinals' Mark McGwire and the Chicago Cubs' Sammy Sosa embarked on a chase of one of Major League Baseball's most hallowed records, igniting the passion and imagination of fans and non-fans everywhere.

programme.desc: East Carolina (33-25) makes its seventh-straight NCAA Regional appearance and 35th in program history after winning the 2025 AAC Tournament title; Florida (38-20), which has won 18 of its last 24 games, has not missed the postseason since 2007.

programme.title: Full Court Press
programme.desc: The accomplishments and achievements of Iowa's Caitlin Clark, South Carolina's Kamilla Cardoso and UCLA's Kiki Rice are chronicled as they go through the 2023-24 season, showcasing the memorable moments and record-breaking performances.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Miami (Fla.) (31-24) makes its 50th NCAA Tournament appearance, tied for third most all-time behind only Texas (64) and Florida State (61); Alabama (41-16), which is 8-7 all-time against the Hurricanes, makes its third-straight postseason appearance.

programme.title: DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Columbus claimed a 2-0 victory against Nashville in their most recent meeting from the 2024 season on July 3 with goals from Christian Ramirez and Diego Rossi; Cucho Hernández and Yaw Yeboah provided the assists for the Crew in the win.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Los Angeles claimed a 2-1 victory against San Jose in their most recent meeting from the group stage of the Leagues Cup on July 31 through a 90th-minute winner from Miguel Berry; LA's Riqui Puig played 6 key passes and recorded 4 tackles in the win.

programme.title: PGA Tour Champions Golf

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The tournament, which features a $20 million purse, is one of only five events given "invitational" status by the PGA TOUR and includes a reduced field of just 69 golfers; Scottie Scheffler finished with a one-stroke victory in last year's edition.
